intro.heading: The bank takes. The market gives.
intro.body: Money sitting in an account loses value. Invested — it grows. That’s not magic, it’s compound interest.

form.step1Desc: How much do you have saved up right now?
form.step2Desc: How much can you set aside each month?
form.step3Desc: What yearly return do you expect?
form.step4Desc: How many years will you stay invested?
form.initialInvestmentHint: Your starting lump sum — €0 is perfectly fine
form.annualReturnHint: 8–10% is typical for a broad stock index fund

howItWorks.label: How does this work?
howItWorks.body: This calculator simulates compound interest — where your returns start generating their own returns. Example: invest €1,000 and earn 9% — that's €90. Next year, the full €1,090 earns 9%. The gap between what you put in and your final portfolio value is pure market gain — money the market made for you, not from your salary. The MSCI World Index tracks ~1,400 large and mid-cap companies across 23 developed countries. It is the benchmark behind most global ETFs available in Europe. Historical average return: ~9-10% per year over the last 32 years.

results.growthHeadline: Your money could grow {{times}}× — that's the power of compounding
results.totalValueDesc: What your portfolio will be worth after the full period
results.totalContributionsDesc: Your own money put in over time
results.investmentGainsDesc: Extra money earned through compound interest — for free
